intro: Eschweilera biflava, commonly known as the yellow-bellied wax palm, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Arecaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and clustered, fan-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into woody fruits containing edible seeds. Eschweilera biflava is adapted to humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
